Contradict fact: The claim that Barack Obama was president when Hurricane Katrina hit New Orleans in 2005 contradicts the fact that he did not become president until November 2008.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on misinformation and ignores the factual timeline of events.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Obama was responsible for the response to Hurricane Katrina, even though he was not in office at the time.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim ignores the alternative explanation that the response to Hurricane Katrina was the responsibility of the then-president, George W. Bush.
